English | CBZ | 50 Pages

Superman: For Earth
Publisher:  DC Comics
Publication Date:  April 1991

Writer:  Roger Stern
Penciller:  Kerry Gammill
Inker:  Dennis Janke
Colorist:  Tom McCraw
Letterer:  Bill Oakley
Cover:  Jerry Ordway

In a special one-shot story printed on recycled paper, Roger Stern uses Superman as an introduction to ecological issues.

After a conversation with his fiancee, Lois Lane, Superman decides to start cleaning up the pollution of Metropolis. However, when he starts to see the more global problem of environmental abuse, he begins to wonder how much even the world's greatest super hero can do to prevent Earth from going the same way as his home planet of Krypton.
